etymologies: early 19th century; earliest use found in Hannibal Evans Lloyd (1771–1847), philologist and translator. From scientific Latin geonoma from Hellenistic Greek γεωνόμος colonist (from ancient Greek γεω- + -νόμος, combining form from the stem of νέμειν to manage), so called on account of its rapid propagation

definitions: A tree of the genus Geonoma, which comprises small palms native to forested areas of South and Central America. Also (in form Geonoma): the genus itself.
